attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women won’t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Integrate reCAPTCHA so signatures are legitimate rather than bot scripted.
attributes.background: If media agencies are going to quote the numbers of signatories as being indicative of public support then this website needs to do more to ensure that bots can't sign it. Using Google's free reCAPTCHA service would be a simple way of stripping out the vast majority of bots.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Set a goal of landing a person on the Moon by 2050.
attributes.background: A lot of people feel that the United Kingdom no longer has a sense of unity or direction in the wake of the EU referendum. Setting this goal would bring it back, as well as boosting industry and encouraging skilled workers to remain in the UK. It would also help our position as part of ESA.
attributes.additional_details: Only a few countries in the world are capable of launching humans into space and sadly neither the UK nor any member states of the European Space Agency have this capability. By setting this goal we will send a clear message to the world that we are still looking to be at the for front of technical innovation and achievement. It will also raise public awareness of the UK's satellite industry and encourage more people to get involved in science and technology.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Postpone Brexit by a year until we find out how US will be under new president
attributes.background: The USA president has issued several executive orders some of which are in contravention of international norms. There could be repercussions internationally and until we know the long term outcome we should not trigger Brexit just now which would mean reliance on an unstable trading partner of USA.
attributes.additional_details: Trump has issued many executive orders already, one of which is in contravention of the Geneva Convention on refugees. In retaliation at the ban on nationals from seven Muslim countries, Iran and Iraq are already discussing banning US nationals. This could produce further instability in an the Middle East. It would be naive of the UK to exit the single market and rely on trade with a country that not only disregards international norms but could alienate our other trading partners. Wait a year.

attributes.action: People on long term job seekers allowance to do free work for the local councils
attributes.background: I think people that have been on job seekers allowance for more than 3 years. Should have to work for there local councils, picking litter and other jobs such as this, so that the local councils can spend there money more wisely.

attributes.action: Reinstate Functional Skills as an alternative for Level 3 EYE's
attributes.background: I am concerned that in 2014, the government altered the requirements for those taking Level 3 in EYE and now, all Level 3 EYE's must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths to count in the ratios - with equitable alternatives such as Functional Skills no longer considered as an option.
attributes.additional_details: Potential new recruits, who have all the skills, including good English and maths, to be excellent Early Years Educators, will be barred from the sector. Its only a matter of time before we do not have the practitioners to fill the much needed roles which will have catastrophic impact on the Early Years sector, and in turn on parents and children. 30 hours free Child care is on its way.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Temporary ban on United States citizens entering UK
attributes.background: In support and recognition of the US President's ban on countries deemed a "national security risk", we request the government issue a temporary ban on immigration and refugees from the dangerous state of the USA. Statistics show that additional security is required when admitting from this country.
attributes.additional_details:
Murder rate of USA is 3.9 compared with UK 0.9.

Gun death rate of USA is 10.54 compared with UK 0.23.

In 2015, American Dylann Roof killed 9 people in a terrorist attack.

In 1995, American Timothy McVeigh killed 169 people in a terrorist attack.

Between 1978 and 1995, American Ted Kaczynski carried out 16 terrorist bombings, killing 3.

In 2015, American Rizwan Farook killed 14 people in a terrorist attack.

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.

attributes.action: This nation should prohibit extradition of people to the USA.
attributes.background: The USA has a president who advocates torture and the USA practices imprisonment without trial at Guantanamo Bay. Both these are abhorent to any civilised society.

attributes.action: Stop intelligence sharing with the USA and recall the UK Ambassador to the USA.
attributes.background: Suspend intelligence sharing with the USA to ensure that President Trump's new policy of religious discrimination is in no way assisted by the UK.The UK should also condem these actions by recalling the ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
If we should learn anything from the Holocaust it is that descrimination based on religious beliefs is wrong and dangerous. 

"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Socialist. 
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me- and there was no one left to speak for me." Martin Niemöller

attributes.action: Bring back EMA money allowance for college students.
attributes.background: College students in need of money in order to support themselves instead of living off the bare minimum.

attributes.action: Bring democracy to the workplace
attributes.background: Many of us today take great pride having democracy in politics, but one place we have never tried to implement democracy, the place we spend most of our adult life, is the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, I ask for this petition to include workers in each workplace to have the right to,

form a union

elect and deselect members of management

have a say on wages and hours

have a say on how the workplace is run and how the profits are used

allowed to have a weekly/monthly meeting to discuss and vote on anything the workers feel are necessary for the workplace

attributes.action: Have a cross party panel run the nhs rather than the government.
attributes.background: A cross party panel could make long term decisions for the nhs rather than the government making short term decisions based on their political ideology, popularity and what will keep the government in power.

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: Require companies to give paid & undisclosed leave for Dysmenorrhea(period pain)
attributes.background: The higher the amount 'ill' days an employee or a prospective employee has can negatively affect employment. Symptoms are directly related to being a women. Some would say women need to be able to take days off every month without any record of them not working that day and to be paid in full.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/mar/02/uk-company-introduce-period-policy-female-staff
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38207846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37438767
http://zodiakmalawi.com/component/k2/why-every-woman-should-be-offered-menstrual-leave
http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Periods-painful/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Add Sports to the school curriculum
attributes.background: Our nation is known to celebrate sporting achievements in football, golf, rugby, olympics etc. But schools do not support them. We should have sports as part of the subjects chosen in secondary school. This way students who excel at physical activities are able to gain scholarships for their gifts

attributes.action: Increase the age to play the lottery from 16 to 18 the same as other gambling.
attributes.background: I have seen how gambling affects people. A 16 year old could buy a ticket and win millions. This could be dangerous, it could cause them to go off the rails.They could get in with the wrong crowd and be led into a life of drink and drugs.  This amount of money should be with adult supervision.
attributes.additional_details: You have to be 18 to gamble in this country, for example fruit machines, betting shops and casinos. Why is the lottery any different?

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: Make all GP's open for half a day every Saturday or Sunday
attributes.background: There are so many people that can't get time off work for doctor's appointments due to their regular working weeks, example, 9-5 Monday to Friday. Opening the GP's for a couple of hours at the weekend will allow for those that struggle to arrange doctor's appointments without having to book holidays
attributes.additional_details: I work as a healthcare assistant, Monday to Friday, if i didn't turn up to work their would be vulnerable adults left at risk, but I still need to look after my own health, if I get ill so do my clients. Why should I have to book holiday to see the doctor.

attributes.action: Government must restrict FIFA officials travel to the UK pending a full apology
attributes.background: It is at the government's discretion to restrict access to the UK of those deemed to be unconducive to the public interest. FIFA decision to enter into disciplinary proceedings against both the English & Scottish teams for wearing the universal emblem of remembrance the poppy is just that.
attributes.additional_details: Civilised cultures remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in defending freedom, the wearing of the poppy isn't restricted to remembering British fallen but those of the commonwealth and respect of those who thought against us in the hope their sacrifice wasn't in vain. The poppy isn't a political image but one of hope/respect and even reconsideration. Any travel ban on FIFA officials should stand until such time as a full and unconditional apology is made to both nations teams by FIFA.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Call to ban any form of media that incites xenophobia, racism or hate.
attributes.background: There should be no tolerance to established media holding extreme, sensationalist views that provoke racial segregation, inequality and hatred toward others.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 we should not be using or allowing history to be a light suggestion of how to move forwards in becoming a more balanced and fair society that extends its care not just to the perimeters of its own towns and countries but to the entire world. We live in a multicultural society that extends to a multicultural world and we cannot continue to allow low rate tabloids or any other form of media to provoke anger in to people that gives rise to views of racism and segregation and fuels hatred.

attributes.action: Lower the sound limit of fireworks that can be sold to the public 50 decibels
attributes.background: A petition has recently gone around asking to ban the sale of fireworks to the public, and the response has been somewhat disappointing. As a compromise we are asking to lower the sound limit from 120 to 50 decibels to minimise stress on animals and people.

attributes.action: Close all retail stores on New Year's Day
attributes.background: New Year's Day is the day after we celebrate the year before and can't do that if we are at work

attributes.action: Give long term partners the same inheritance rights as a spouse
attributes.background: I lost my partner of 25 years, we owned a home and a business together. When he died without leaving a will I had to buy his share of our business, home and buy all of his belongings at the full market value from his only son. I was not financially dependent on him and therefore had no entitlement.

attributes.action: Call on the Government not to spend further public money on the Olympic stadium.
attributes.background:
The original structure became the new home of West Ham United from last August. The conversion costs £272m, of which the football club will pay just £15m plus annual rent of £2.5m, bringing the final price tag to £702m. 

Problems with the seating will now cost the tax payer more millions to fix
attributes.additional_details: The government preferred to produce a brief for an athletics only stadium which would be largely disassembled after the games with the lower tier remaining in place as a permanent athletics facility to replace the Crystal Palace National Sports Centre. With the original Olympic design finalised and being built, the government had a change of heart and a bidding process for a multi-sport post-Olympic legacy was launched.

attributes.action: Save Scotland's Military bases
attributes.background: The Government has decided that 8 of Scotland's Military Bases will close within the the next 16 yrs. This is unacceptable! We in Scotland have some of the best fighting forces in the world, but due to a shortsighted Tory regime, they are going to remove most of our capabilities!

attributes.action: Lower the curfew of fireworks to 9pm on a normal night
attributes.background: The curfew for fireworks should be lowered to 9pm on a normal night because little children go to bed at 9pm & dogs will not be afraid for too long & their owners will be able to get to sleep not worrying about there pets.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for new Vehicles to have automatic emergency braking
attributes.background: To help prevent accidents and deaths on the road by making it a legal requirement for new cars, vans and trucks to have automatic emergency braking systems

attributes.action: i would like to propose one day a year where all commercial flights are banned.
attributes.background: Reports have been released showing the extent that the flight ban after 9/11 had on climate change. These reports show promising figures of an overall drop of average temperature. I believe that by banning non necessary and commercial flights for one day a year could help to slow down global warming
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/artificial-weather-revealed-post-9-11-flight-groundings 
http://globalnews.ca/news/2934513/empty-skies-after-911-set-the-stage-for-an-unlikely-climate-change-experiment/
i have supplied two sources which both support my claim however many more are available with a simple google search.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Oxfordshire's membership of the European Union
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU Referendum Oxfordshire voted to stay in the EU 70% to 30% but now risk being dragged out of the EU like Scotland and having a vote on the membership is in no way subverting democracy
attributes.additional_details: Oxford is a city who's economy is reliant on the EU and dragging them out would be completely undemocratic

attributes.action: Disallow M.P.s working for firms who have successfully lobbied them as ministers
attributes.background: M.P.s should not profit from their time in office, consorting with firms who lobby them. offering jobs after they leave office, for being compliant with their requests.
attributes.additional_details: Too many M.P.s from the last government and the previous one who held high office went on after losing their seats to take up posts with the very people who had been lobbying them for lucrative  contracts. The health service, television,the eco industry to name a few. M.P.s should be in office to serve the people not feather their nests for the future.

attributes.action: Ensure there's a legal entitlement to contact with siblings and half-siblings
attributes.background:
Individuals should be entitled to contact with their siblings (including 'half-' and step-siblings) under 18, unless the courts deem that there is reasonable concern this would have a negative impact on the child's welfare. 
As the law currently stands, there's no rights of access for siblings.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'nuclear family model' (a father, mother and their children) is no longer representative of the family dynamics within the UK. 
Therefore, we hope a law will be put in place to ensure siblings are entitled to contact with each other, as the law does not currently serve to protect that special, intimate bond they share. If the parent with custody decided to stop access to the other parent, the siblings suffer consequently - being unable to see each other.
